results.definition: make more complex, intricate, or richer
reduce to a fine, unmixed, or pure state; separate from extraneous matter or cleanse from impurities
improve or perfect by pruning or polishing
attenuate or reduce in vigor, strength, or intensity by polishing or purifying
examples: many valuable nutrients are refined out of the foods in our modern diet

results.definition: make more precise or increase the discriminatory powers of
examples: refine the constant in the equation

results.definition: treat or prepare so as to put in a usable condition
